main event: A radar sighting occurred in the North Atlantic on 18 April 1948, where an unidentified object was tracked at 11,000 ft and a speed of 20 mph.
interesting points: The radar contact was thoroughly searched visually, but no physical objects or weather fronts were found in the area.
The target's strength was 55 fading at 15,000 yards, and the target was observed fading from view at high altitude.
The report includes a checklist detailing the characteristics of the unidentified flying object, such as its speed, distance from the observer, and manner of disappearance.

Dr. Hynek's evaluations extracted from the Project Grudge report categorize various incidents into different probabilities and explanations, from astronomical to non-astronomical with no evident explanation.
The document was forwarded to the Headquarters Air Materiel Command, Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Dayton, Ohio for further information.
result: The report suggests that the incident was categorized as a radar sighting of an unidentified object, and the evaluation in the document raises the possibility of the sighting referring to a flock of migrating birds.
